items.description: Beverley Brook area in Merton, Sutton, Kingston upon Thames, Richmond upon Thames and Wandsworth
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Kingston upon Thames, Merton, Richmond upon Thames, Surrey, Sutton, Wandsworth
floodArea.riverOrSea: Beverley Brook, Pyl Brook, East Pyl Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. Further isolated showers are forecast today which may cause minor surface water issues but are not expected to be as heavy or widespread as those experienced on Sunday and impacts on the rivers are considered unlikely but we will continue to monitor the situation closely. The weather remains unsettled for the rest of the week and heavy rainfall is possible which may require further alerts to be issued.

The water level in the Eastern Yar remains very high and is rising. Overnight 17mm of rain was recorded at Wroxall, 27mm at Knighton. The rain fell in 2 hours, and is a significant amount in a short period of time.  Today (27/07/21), flooding to land, cycle tracks and access paths will continue along the Yar Valley. At Alverstone and Langbridge, the river will reach a similar level to yesterday morning (and could rise a few cms higher). It will flood gardens, surround property, flood the main road at Alverstone, Golf Links and Moreton Common Road. Today and for the rest of this week, showers, which at times, will be heavy and slow moving, are forecast. Whilst most of the rain has currently cleared the area, further rain could impact the river today. At Alverstone, the river will rise until at least 14:00. At Sandown, it wonâ€™t peak until the early hours of Wednesday morning, rising to bank full at the main road bridge. We continue to monitor the forecast. At Alverstone and Langbridge, please take action to protect property. This message will be updated by 15:00 on Tuesday 27/07/21.

items.message: The risk of flooding in the London area has now reduced as the risk of thunderstorms has passed. No flooding is currently expected for today (Monday 26 July), but there is further rainfall forecast for later this week. We are monitoring this forecast closely and will issue further alerts if required.

items.message: The risk of flooding in the London area has now reduced as the risk of thunderstorms has passed. No flooding is currently expected for today (Monday 26 July), but there is further rainfall forecast for later this week. We are monitoring this forecast closely and will issue further alerts if required.

The risk of flooding in the London area has now reduced as the risk of thunderstorms has passed. No flooding is currently expected for today (Monday 26 July), but there is further rainfall forecast for later this week. We are monitoring this forecast closely and will issue further alerts if required.

This Flood Alert remains in force for Monday eveningâ€™s tide due to now stronger winds than previously forecast. The forecast high water is 21:30 on 26/07/2021 with a level of 6.14 mAOD and a Force 4 westerly wind. All times are local and refer to the high water time at Hinkley Point, mAOD is height above average sea level. Local flood impacts are possible this evening, and conditions may apply one to two hours either side of the high tide. Flooding may affect the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir. High tide levels will reduce in the coming days, however moderate Force 4 to Force 6 winds are forecast this week. Please be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads, and stay aware in case further updates are issued. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by midday on Tuesday 27/07/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Lee from Hoddesdon to Canning Town

floodArea.county: Enfield, Essex, Greater London, Hackney, Haringey, Hertfordshire, Newham, Tower Hamlets, Waltham Forest

items.message: The risk of flooding in the Lower River Lee from Hoddesdon to Canning Town has now reduced as the risk of thunderstorms has passed. No flooding is currently expected for today (Monday 26 July), but there is further rainfall forecast for later this week. We are monitoring this forecast closely and will issue further alerts if required.

The water level in the Monktonmead Brook is high and rising. More intense rain has fallen with nearly 30mm in the last four hours recorded at Ryde. This is about half a monthâ€™s total. In the next hour, water will begin to flow across the railway tracks, upstream of St Johns Station. Surface water may already be causing impacts as drains become overloaded. Property flooding is not currently expected at this time but we will keep under review. Further thundery showers are still possible over the next 24 hours. Water levels will remain very high until at least 06:00. Our operational staff will keep the Monktonmead Brook clear of reported blockages. Please consider moving vehicles from depots located next to the river and railway line. We will update this message by 11:00 27/07/2021.

items.description: Whitwell, Wroxall, Langbridge, Alverstone on the Eastern Yar
items.message: The water level in the Eastern Yar remains very high, but it is now slowly falling. In Langbridge, Horringford and Alverstone, out of bank flooding affecting gardens, roads, access tracks and cycle paths is expected to continue over the next 18 hours. A Flood Alert will remain in force and will be updated regularly to cover these impacts. Today (Monday 26/07/21) and for the rest of this week, there is the potential for further heavy showers to develop. The river will remain incredibly sensitive to further rainfall, so should any heavy rain affect the area (especially over the next 12 hours) then we may need to issue further advice and messages.

items.description: River Beult from Pluckley and Bethersden to Hampstead Lock at Yalding
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further thunderstorms are forecast over the next 3 days, with low confidence over exact timing and locations. 

We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay aware in case further Alerts or warnings are issued.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  River levels have now fallen at the Stapleford river gauge.  The forecast for today is for potentially scattered heavy showers, we recommend that you keep up to date with the forecast.      

We will continue to monitor the situation and provide an update if the situation changes.
